page.title: 07A FARM AT BENTHAM
page.content: On our 200 acre farm we have 13 beef cattle, sheep and dairy cattle. Each season brings varied work on top of the day to day routine. Spring time is our lambing season. We have 200 breeding ewes and about 400 lambs. In Summer we cut the grass for silage to feed the cattle in Winter. We also make hay. The sheep are shorn and the wool sent to the Wool Marketing Board. In Autumn our lambs are fat and go to market. The dairy cows and beef cattle come inside for the Winter. Each day of the year the cows have to be milked, buildings cleaned out and sometimes given drugs to prevent them from becoming ill. We spread fertilizer on the fields, hedges have to be laid and dry stone walls repaired.
